source_note: State baseline derived from Vermont Universal Recycling Law (Act 148) and ANR solid waste guidance.

organics.guidance: Statewide ban on food scraps in trash under Act 148; composting required for all residents and businesses.
organics.bin: Green organics bin or backyard compost system.
organics.notes: Food scraps must be separated from trash statewide.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue recycling bin or drop-off center.
paper_cardboard.notes: Greasy or waxed paper not accepted.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and tin cans (empty and clean).

plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.
provenance: VT ANR Universal Recycling materials guide

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Vermont has a 5¢ or 15¢ deposit on beverage containers depending on type.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Return to redemption center or retailer.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: Covers most glass, metal, and plastic containers.

household_batteries.guidance: Batteries accepted statewide through Call2Recycle and HHW facilities.
household_batteries.notes: All battery types accepted for recycling.
provenance: Vermont ANR HHW and battery recycling

e_waste.guidance: Covered electronic devices banned from disposal under Vermont E-Cycles law.
e_waste.bin: Drop-off at free E-Cycles collection site.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags, foam containers, and straws banned statewide since 2020.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Use reusable bags; film return at store drop-offs only.

bulky_items.guidance: Schedule pickup or bring bulky items to transfer station.
bulky_items.notes: Local solid waste districts manage bulky collection.
